möbius strip fidget tips 1 you can make a lightly beaded möbius strip fidget or a heavily beaded möbius strip fidget in any of 3 sizes small medium or large work row 1 to row 5 for a small möbius strip fidget work row 1 to row 7 for a medium möbius strip fidget work row 1 to row 9 for a large möbius strip fidget you can also make a möbius strip fidget without beads by replacing the bead instruction with a single_crochet 2 this pattern is intended to use beads and was written for worsted/medium/4 weight yarn you can change the yarn weight hook size and bead size per your preference as there is no specific required gauge this pattern does not use fiberfill i used 3 types of beads in the creation of this pattern rondelle beads that are approximately 14mm wide by 8mm tall with a 5mm hole i used a 4mm hook with these beads pony beads that are 9mm x 6mm with a 4mm hole i used a 3 5mm hook with these beads and large pony beads that are 11mm x 8mm with a 4mm hole i used a 3 5mm hook with these beads you can use any size beads with whatever size hook fits through the hole in the bead to crochet them to attach so long as the hook is usable with your yarn choice 3 there are 3 different ways to crochet beads to attach in this pattern you can use them interchangeably you could also replace a bead instruction with a regular single_crochet to avoid using beads the first way embeds the beads in the crochet work this makes for a smoother piece and the bead can spin in place a bit if the bead is smooth see tip 4 the second way leaves the bead on top of the crochet work which makes it stick out more and makes it easier to grab at/pull at/fidget with the bead see tip 5 the third way uses 2 beads in one stitch to put one on the top and the back of the crochet work so that there are beads on either side that stick out more and are easier to grab at/pull at/fidget with the bead see tip 6 i recommend that you work a lightly beaded möbius strip fidget first before
